definition:
The hypergeometric equation is the following linear ordinary
differential equation:
$$x (1 - x) y'' + (c - (a + b + 1) x ) y' - aby = 0$$ (Here, $a$, $b$,
and $c$ are complex constants.)

The solutions of this equation may be expressed in terms of the
hypergeometric function, hence the name.

The hypergeometric equation is a Fuchsian differential equation with
singularities at $0$, $1$, and $\infty$. By a suitable change of
variables, any second order Fuchsian differential equation may be
converted into a hypergeometric equation.
